contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox person |name=Jennifer Leak |birth_name={{bda|1950|9|28}} |birth_place=[[Montreal]], [[Quebec]] |occupation=[[Actress]] |spouse=[[Tim Matheson]] <small>(1968-1971) }} '''Jennifer Leak''' (born September 28, 1950 in [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]]) is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[film]] and [[television]] [[actress]], best known for her role as Colleen North in the 1968 film ''[[Yours, Mine and Ours (1968 film)|Yours, Mine and Ours]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jennifer Leak|work=[[The New York Times]]|url=http://movies.nytimes.com/person/946770/Jennifer-Leak}}</ref> Leak played the role of Olive Springer Gordon Randolph in the [[soap opera]] ''[[Another World (TV series)|Another World]]'' (1976–1979), and Blanche Bouvier in ''[[Guiding Light]]'' (1981). In addition, Jennifer created the role of Gwen Sherman, who started out as a prostitute who fell in love with Greg Foster and ended up becoming a nun in the mid-1970s on the CBS soap, ''[[The Young and the Restless]]''. She also played guest spots on various [[television|TV]] shows, including ''[[Mary Tyler Moore (TV series)|Mary Tyler Moore]]'' and ''[[Hawaii Five-O]]''. Jennifer married [[actor]] [[Tim Matheson]], having met during the filming of ''Yours, Mine and Ours''. The marriage lasted only a short time (1968–1971). ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{imdb name|0495015}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Leak, Jennifer | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Actress | DATE OF BIRTH = September 28, 1950 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Montreal]], [[Quebec]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Leak, Jennifer}} [[Category:Canadian film actresses]] [[Category:Canadian soap opera actresses]] [[Category:Canadian television actresses]] [[Category:Actresses from Montreal]] [[Category:1950 births]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Canada-actor-stub}}
